Package org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation

Class VehicleUnit

java.lang.Object
org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation.AbstractSimulationUnit
org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation.VehicleUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommunicationModuleOwner, PerceptionModuleOwner, AdHocCommunicative, CellCommunicative, Locatable, Navigable, Perceptive, OperatingSystem, VehicleOperatingSystem, EventProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElectricVehicleUnit
public class VehicleUnit extends AbstractSimulationUnit implements VehicleOperatingSystem, PerceptionModuleOwner
This class represents a vehicle in the application simulator.

    • changeLane

      public void changeLane(VehicleLaneChange.VehicleLaneChangeMode vehicleLaneChangeMode, long duration)
      Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
      Forces a lane change to the lane according to the specified mode; If successful, the lane will be chosen for the given amount of time.

      Note: use changeLane(), for mode VehicleLaneChangeMode.index.
      Specified by:
      changeLane in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
      Parameters:
      vehicleLaneChangeMode - mode to change lane
      duration - the duration for the lane change in nanoseconds

    • slowDown

      public void slowDown(float speed, long duration)
      Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
      Slow down the vehicle with the given Id to the given speed until the given time (the vehicle is not guaranteed to have the given speed at the end of the given time). With this command it is possible to simulate e.g., instant brakes, slowing down, etc.
      Specified by:
      slowDown in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
      Parameters:
      speed - new speed
      duration - Time interval for which the slow down should be valid, after that interval the vehicle will accelerate again. Unit: [ns].

    • changeSpeedWithInterval

      public void changeSpeedWithInterval(double newSpeed, long interval)
      Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
      Allows control over the vehicles speed.
      Specified by:
      changeSpeedWithInterval in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
      Parameters:
      newSpeed - is the target speed in [m/s]
      interval - the new speed should be reached in [ns]

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      newSpeed - is the target speed in [m/s]
      forcedAcceleration - is the acceleration in m/s², forced acceleration with highest priority

      public void stopNow(VehicleStopMode vehicleStopMode, long durationInNs)
      Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      vehicleStopMode - Stop mode

    • requestVehicleParametersUpdate

      public VehicleParameters.VehicleParametersChangeRequest requestVehicleParametersUpdate()
      Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
      Returns a request object, which can be used to change vehicle parameters. After changing relevant parameters, this request object must be passed to VehicleOperatingSystem.applyVehicleParametersChange(VehicleParameters.VehicleParametersChangeRequest) in order to apply the vehicle parameters.
      Specified by:
      requestVehicleParametersUpdate in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
      Returns:
      an request object, which can be used to change vehicle parameters.

    • getBasicSensorModule

      public BasicSensorModule getBasicSensorModule()
      Description copied from interface: Perceptive
      Returns a basic sensor module which provides single integer values for given SensorTypes. Can be used, e.g., to detect preconfigured icy roads, or rainy areas in conjunction with the mosaic-environment simulator.
      Specified by:
      getBasicSensorModule in interface Perceptive

    • getLidarSensorModule

      public LidarSensorModule getLidarSensorModule()
      Description copied from interface: Perceptive
      Returns a LiDAR sensor module which provides complex 3D PointCloud data. To be able to retrieve such data, a sensor model must be provided by a coupled simulator, such as PHABMACS or Carla.
      Specified by:
      getLidarSensorModule in interface Perceptive
